Material used.Material Name: Peripheral blood lymphocytes of a patient with early - onset PD and normal individuals (controls)
Material used.Description: A female patient with early - onset PD was the donor of blood samples. Controls were normal individuals, all of matching age and gender with the patient. Mononuclear cells were obtained from peripheral blood by density gradient centrifugation over Ficoll - Paque PLUS. Transformation was carried out with the use of supernatant obtained from B95 - 8 lymphoblastoid cell line established from peripheral blood lymphocytes of a cotton - top marmoset following in vitro infection with EBV.

For resuscitation, cells were placed at 37°C for 30 sec, transferred to 10 ml of cold culture medium while in ice, collected by a 5 min spin at 1,000 rpm and resuspended in 5 - ml fresh RPMI. Cells were maintained in RPMI 1640, supplemented with L - glutamine (2 mM), penicillin (100 U/ml), streptomycin (100 U/ml), sodium pyruvate (1 mM), sodium bicarbonate (50 mM), non - essential amino acids (1×) and 10% heat - inactivated fetal bovine serum (FBS), at 37°C in a humidified 5% CO₂ atmosphere.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Detection of the c.157G>A (Formerly G209A) Sequence Variation

Material used.Material Name: Blood and lymphoblastoid cell lines from the patient and controls
Material used.Description: Blood samples were collected after informed consent. DNA from blood and from lymphoblastoid cell lines was extracted. RNA from lymphoblastoid cell lines was also extracted.

Readout description.Conclusion: The patient was found to carry the p.Ala53Thr mutation, and monoallelic expression of the normal SNCA allele was documented as the band pattern expected for the mutant allele was absent in RT - PCR analysis
Readout description.Result Description: PCR product was 216 bp. Mutation c.157G>A creates a polymorphic site for enzyme Tsp45I, and the mutant allele is identified by RFLP analysis. RT - PCR product is 500 bp, and the mutant allele is identified by RFLP analysis after Tsp45I digestion. Digestion of the wild - type allele of the SNCA gene with this enzyme gives four fragments (249, 218, 24, and 9 bp), whereas digestion of the c.157G>A allele gives five fragments (249, 185, 33, 24, and 9 bp). Bands from 33 bp down to 9 bp are not detectable with the present system.

Material used.Material Name: Lymphoblastoid cell lines from the patient
Material used.Description: Cells were used at a concentration of 2.5 - 3×10⁵ cells/ml in a total volume of 10 ml per flask, and subsequently, a drug (5 - aza - 2 - deoxycytidine, 4 - phenylbutyrate or trichostatin A) was added to a flask and was thoroughly resuspended. In all cases a control flask was left untreated.

Readout description.Conclusion: 5 - aza - 2 - deoxycytidine did not reactivate the silenced allele, while 4 - phenylbutyrate and trichostatin A reactivated the silenced allele
Readout description.Result Description: Treatment with 5 - aza - 2 - deoxycytidine (1.0 mM daily dose for 48 hr) showed no reactivation of the silenced allele. Treatment with 4 - phenylbutyrate (5 mM for 24 hr) and trichostatin A (0.5 mM for maximum 15 hr) reactivated the silenced allele.

Basic positive control.Description: A control flask was left untreated.

Material used.Material Name: DNA from the patient and three unrelated, normal control individuals
Material used.Description: Two micrograms of DNA diluted in 20 ml ddH₂O were denatured, treated with hydroquinone/sodium bisulphite solution, and then processed through several steps including purification, incubation with NaOH, and further purification. PCR reactions were performed using five different primer sets on bisulphite - modified DNA.

Readout description.Conclusion: All analyzed CpG sites were found to be unmethylated in the patient and in normal controls
Readout description.Result Description: PCR products were electrophoresed in a 2% agarose gel to confirm size and identity. For primer set No1 PCR products were digested by the single - cutting methylation - sensitive enzyme AciI. All PCR products were purified and sequenced.

Material used.Material Name: RNA from blood of the patient and normal controls
Material used.Description: RNA was extracted from blood with RNeasy s Mini Kit. RNA was reverse transcribed to cDNA. For real - time PCR, dilutions 1/10 and 1/100 cDNA were amplified using QuantyiFast SYBER Green PCR and the LightCycler2.0.

Readout description.Conclusion: The mRNA in the control ranged from 65.1% to 86.2% of the mRNA of the patient in one set of experiments, and an average of two - fold increase in total SNCA mRNA in the patient was found compared with the total SNCA mRNA of four different control individuals in multiple experiments
Readout description.Result Description: The target SNCA cDNA primers were used, and for data normalization, the Synaptophysin (SYP) gene was used as internal control.

Biological replicates.Description: Three different experiments with each of the four control individuals were carried out.

Material used.Description: Whole genome analysis was performed by microarray analysis using Affymetrix GeneChip Mapping 250 K arrays. 250 ng of total genomic DNA were digested with NspI, ligated with adaptors, amplified, fragmented, labeled
